author: Special Correspondent
text:
Whether he will score a centum will depend on how the announcements are implemented: Karunanidhi

Welcoming the impetus given to agriculture and rural development in the budget, DMK president M. Karunanidhi, on Monday, said Prime Minister Narendra Modi had “passed the examination”.

“Mr. Modi had termed the budget as the examination he was writing. Whether he will score a centum and get full victory will depend on how the announcements are implemented and the changes it creates. But I feel like saying in the current situation that he has passed the examination,” the DMK president said.

Appreciating the focus given to agriculture, in particular the proposal to double the per capita income of farmers in six years, he said the lack of change in income tax slabs was a disappointment to the middle class.

Meanwhile, the reaction of DMDK president Vijayakant may put the BJP, which is trying to bring him into the NDA fold, in a spot.

'Two sides of a coin'

“As far as this budget is concerned, like two sides of a coin, it contains features that could be welcomed and criticised,” he said.

The budget lacked announcements to fulfil the promise the Prime Minister made recently that the income of farmers would be doubled.

The absence of measures to deal with black money expeditiously was also disappointing, he said.

PMK founder S. Ramadoss said that while he welcomed announcements in various sectors such as agriculture, health, education and rural development, the Centre should ensure the schemes did not remain on paper.

Big disappointment

Tamil Maanila Congress president G.K. Vasan said the budget did not satisfy the people.

The lack of any announcement on writing off farm debts was a big disappointment, Mr. Vasan said.

Vijayakant says budget has features that can be welcomed as well as criticised
title: ‘Modi has passed the test’
